channel.title: Natural Language Processing on NeurIPS 2024
channel.description: Recent content in Natural Language Processing on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: Aligner: Efficient Alignment by Learning to Correct
item.description: Aligner efficiently aligns LLMs by learning to correct initial responses, achieving significant improvements in helpfulness and harmlessness across various models with resource efficiency.

item.title: Cracking the Code of Juxtaposition: Can AI Models Understand the Humorous Contradictions
item.description: Can AI understand humor? A new benchmark, YESBUT, reveals that even state-of-the-art models struggle with the nuanced humor of juxtaposed comics, highlighting the need for improved AI in understandin…

item.title: Decompose, Analyze and Rethink: Solving Intricate Problems with Human-like Reasoning Cycle
item.description: DeAR: A novel framework lets LLMs solve complex problems with human-like iterative reasoning.

item.title: Divide-and-Conquer Meets Consensus: Unleashing the Power of Functions in Code Generation
item.description: FUNCODER: a novel code generation framework that uses a divide-and-conquer approach with functional consensus to generate code that meets complex requirements.

item.title: DuQuant: Distributing Outliers via Dual Transformation Makes Stronger Quantized LLMs
item.description: DuQuant: Dual transformations distribute outliers for stronger quantized LLMs.

item.title: HydraLoRA: An Asymmetric LoRA Architecture for Efficient Fine-Tuning
item.description: HydraLoRA: Asymmetric LoRA boosts LLM fine-tuning efficiency by sharing parameters across tasks while specializing others, outperforming existing methods.

item.title: Learning to grok: Emergence of in-context learning and skill composition in modular arithmetic tasks
item.description: Large language models surprisingly solve unseen arithmetic tasks; this work reveals how they learn to compose simple skills into complex ones through in-context learning, showing a transition from mem…

item.title: LLM Evaluators Recognize and Favor Their Own Generations
item.description: LLMs show self-preference bias in evaluations, favoring their own outputs. This study reveals that LLMs surprisingly recognize their own generations, and this self-recognition directly causes the self…

item.title: MDAgents: An Adaptive Collaboration of LLMs for Medical Decision-Making
item.description: MDAgents: An adaptive multi-agent LLM framework boosts medical decision-making accuracy by dynamically adjusting collaboration structures based on task complexity.

item.title: MetaLA: Unified Optimal Linear Approximation to Softmax Attention Map
item.description: MetaLA: Unified optimal linear approximation to softmax attention map, achieving linear complexity and surpassing existing models in various benchmarks.

item.title: Not All Tokens Are What You Need for Pretraining
item.description: RHO-1, a novel language model, uses selective pretraining focusing on high-value tokens, achieving state-of-the-art results with significantly less data than existing models.

item.title: Policy Learning from Tutorial Books via Understanding, Rehearsing and Introspecting
item.description: Researchers developed Policy Learning from tutorial Books (PLfB), a novel method that trains AI agents using knowledge from tutorial books instead of relying solely on real-world data.

item.title: PV-Tuning: Beyond Straight-Through Estimation for Extreme LLM Compression
item.description: PV-Tuning achieves new state-of-the-art in extreme LLM compression by going beyond traditional straight-through estimators (STE). This novel framework provides a more accurate and efficient fine-tunin…

item.title: Questioning the Survey Responses of Large Language Models
item.description: LLM survey responses are systematically biased, often masking genuine model capabilities and leading to misleading alignment conclusions.

item.title: RG-SAN: Rule-Guided Spatial Awareness Network for End-to-End 3D Referring Expression Segmentation
item.description: RG-SAN achieves state-of-the-art 3D referring expression segmentation by leveraging spatial awareness and rule-guided weak supervision, significantly improving accuracy and handling of ambiguous descr…

item.title: Unlocking the Capabilities of Thought: A Reasoning Boundary Framework to Quantify and Optimize Chain-of-Thought
item.description: Reasoning Boundary Framework (RBF) quantitatively assesses and optimizes chain-of-thought (CoT) in LLMs, offering novel metrics and optimization strategies validated across various models and tasks.

item.title: You Only Cache Once: Decoder-Decoder Architectures for Language Models
item.description: YOCO: A decoder-decoder architecture for LLMs dramatically reduces memory usage and improves inference speed by caching key-value pairs only once.
